summary: This bill, the Strengthening Advocacy for Long-Term Care Residents Act, focuses on improving the Long-Term Care Ombudsman program. It amends the Older Americans Act of 1965 to refine training requirements for volunteers, directs the Director of the Office of Long-Term Care Ombudsman Programs to review and update model standards for training. It also addresses the Director's full-time status.  Finally, it mandates a study by the National Academies on the efficacy of State Long-Term Care Ombudsman programs.
